intro: Geitonoplesium cymosum f. rubellum, commonly known as the red-flowered starfruit vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically red or orange in color, which stand out against its green foliage. The plant produces small, edible fruits similar to those of the common starfruit, though the fruit of this variety is often smaller and more intensely flavored. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
